@RepMikeCapuano But make no mistake, the effort to gut the OCE is a stark example of House Republicans’ approach to governing.
@RepMikeCapuano As Chair of the Task Force that wrote the measure creating the OCE, I am relieved it is not being dismantled today.
House Republicans have scrapped plans to obliterate the OCE. Thanks to all who spoke out, your voices made a difference today.
@RepMikeCapuano Transparency, accountability and independence of OCE demolished, the real intention of this change. https://t.co/sOgkq57Tcs
@RepMikeCapuano The practical result of the Republican measure to bring OCE under the House Ethics Committee is to render it ineffective.
@RepMikeCapuano The OCE operates independently of the House Ethics Committee, with the authority to choose which matters merit review.
@RepMikeCapuano I wrote the law creating the OCE; the point was to bring transparency and accountability to the broken House ethics process
@RepMikeCapuano Not the economy, jobs, transportation, repealing the ACA. Republicans start off crushing the independent House ethics office
Outrageous – no other word to describe gutting the Office of Congressional Ethics (OCE), the very first act of the new Republican House.
